{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Inca bone, also known as Goethe's ossicle, is a sutural bone, which means it is located at the junction of cranial bones. The bregma, lambda, pterion, and asterion are all points of confluence of different sutures in the skull. The Inca bone is specifically located at the lambda, which is the point where the sagittal suture meets the lambdoid suture.", "answer_choice": "B. Lambda"}
